result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Locky Dan Chanthalangsy

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
2:09 PM Defendant Locky Dan Chanthalangsy in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Locky Dan Chanthalangsy.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail heard - case has been resolved.
Atty provides plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Spansail agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 without the repeater enhancer.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 5 without the repeater enhancer.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Atty Spansail satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to counts 1 and 5 without the repeater enhancers.
Court dismisses the repeater enhancers from Counts 1 and 5.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2, 3, and 4.
Court orders presentence investigation be completed.  
Agent to provide report to court at least 2 weeks prior to sentencing. 
2:25 PM off record.
2:27 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Court orders Deft to cooperate with the PSI process.
2:27 PM
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:46 AM Defendant Locky Dan Chanthalangsy appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail appeared by video for Locky Dan Chanthalangsy.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of information.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed with Deft.
Deft understands.
Enters not guilty pleas to all counts.
Atty Spansail hear on motion to modify bond.
ADA heard and objects to any modification of bond.
Court heard and amends cash bond to $5000 cash with the same conditions as previously ordered and including one additional condition that the Deft must reside with Scott Houska at N3091 RW in Peshtigo, if released on bond.
Court schedules with parties.
9:54 AM
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:10 pm.

4:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Locky Dan Chanthalangsy appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Locky Dan Chanthalangsy. 
Atty Spansail provides waiver form, reviewed w/Deft, satisfied.
Def waives prelim.
Court finds def freely waives prelim and binds over for trial. 
Court schedules matter with parties for the same date at bond motion.
4:28 pm
Arraignment scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:53 AM Defendant Locky Dan Chanthalangsy appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Locky Dan Chanthalangsy.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed complaint with Deft.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives formal reading.
Requests prelim.
Court schedules with parties.
8:54 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:17 AM Defendant Locky Dan Chanthalangsy appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Spansail heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $10,000 cash bond w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx, no contact including 3rd-party contact with L.C. or A.A. 
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
11:23 AM
